update.description:
This is a port of the [Touch Plugin](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/plugins/TouchPlugin.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) from osrf/Gazebo. 

** Differences from the classical TouchPlugin**

* This port removes the `<sensor>` parameter as the collisions that are marked as contact sensors within a model are determined from the component assigned to them by the Contact system. And since the contact data is accessed via components, there is no means to select the contacts generated by a particular sensor.
* The type for the output topic is `Boolean` instead of `Int`.
* The enable mechanism uses a service instead of a regular pub/sub topic

**Requirements**

* ign-gazebo pull request #174.
update.title: [Acropolis] Add Touch plugin

content.raw: Thanks for pointing this out. It works fine if a robot with the touch plugin was spawned after the world is loaded. The other way around wasn't working (where the a new target collision is spawned). Should be fixed in c0c4966.
content.html: Thanks for pointing this out. It works fine if a robot with the touch plugin was spawned after the world is loaded. The other way around wasn't working (where the a new target collision is spawned). Should be fixed in c0c4966.

content.raw:
Unlikely to reach this if disabled by the user because it checks `enabled`. Added the check you suggested for good measure. a8b34a7.

Good call on the mutex. Added in 1b8751e.
content.html:
Unlikely to reach this if disabled by the user because it checks enabled. Added the check you suggested for good measure. a8b34a7.

Good call on the mutex. Added in 1b8751e.

content.raw: I noticed the `Service call timed out` but I thought it was some firewall issue on my machine. Good to know.
content.html: I noticed the Service call timed out but I thought it was some firewall issue on my machine. Good to know.

content.raw: Do we want to support entities that were spawned after the plugin though? Think of a robot being spawned from a launch file after the world is loaded, or objects being loaded as new levels are reached.
content.html: Do we want to support entities that were spawned after the plugin though? Think of a robot being spawned from a launch file after the world is loaded, or objects being loaded as new levels are reached.

content.raw: It might be a good idea to also check the `nullptr != this->touchedPub`, in case user disables the plugin while this function is running. A mutex could also be an option.
content.html: It might be a good idea to also check the nullptr != this->touchedPub, in case user disables the plugin while this function is running. A mutex could also be an option.

content.raw: How about resetting the publisher before advertising? If I start the simulation paused and call `ign service -s /white_touches_only_green/enable --reqtype ignition.msgs.Boolean --reptype ignition.msgs.Empty --timeout 300 --req 'data:true'`, this error is printed: `Node::Advertise(): Error advertising topic [/white_touches_only_green/touched]. Did you forget to start the discovery service?` - I think it's related to this but I didn't investigate much further.
content.html: How about resetting the publisher before advertising? If I start the simulation paused and call ign service -s /white_touches_only_green/enable --reqtype ignition.msgs.Boolean --reptype ignition.msgs.Empty --timeout 300 --req 'data:true', this error is printed: Node::Advertise(): Error advertising topic [/white_touches_only_green/touched]. Did you forget to start the discovery service? - I think it's related to this but I didn't investigate much further.

content.raw: I didn't know that using an empty message as a placeholder could work, maybe it works for empty requests too. The only weird thing though is that it prints `Service call timed out`, because it probably waits for a response. I'll add some notes to [this ign-transport issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/issues/97/call-one-way-requester-responder-from).
content.html: I didn't know that using an empty message as a placeholder could work, maybe it works for empty requests too. The only weird thing though is that it prints Service call timed out, because it probably waits for a response. I'll add some notes to this ign-transport issue.

content.raw: Thanks for the documentation! It's just a bit suspenseful in the end. "and"...? :wink:
content.html: Thanks for the documentation! It's just a bit suspenseful in the end. "and"...?
